item.title: Melinda add a quote by Robert Munsch
item.description:
"Prince Ronald said, Elizabeth, your hair is all dirty. You are wearing an ugly paper bag. You don't have any shoes on and you smell like a dragon's ear. Come back and rescue me when you're dressed like a real princess.
Elizabeth said, Ronald, your hair is all nice. Your clothes are all pretty. You look like a nice guy, but guess what? You are a bum.
They didn't get married after all." -- Robert Munsch

item.title: Melinda add a quote by Emily Brontë
item.description: "He's more myself than I am. Whatever our souls are made of, his and mine are the same." -- Emily Brontë

item.title: Melinda add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "A girl likes to be crossed a little in love now and then. It is something to think of" -- Jane Austen

item.title: Melinda add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "There is nothing I would not do for those who are really my friends. I have no notion of loving people by halves, it is not my nature." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Melinda add a quote by Emily Jane Brontë
item.description: "If all else perished, and he remained, I should still continue to be; and if all else remained, and he were annihilated, the universe would turn to a mighty stranger." -- Emily Jane Brontë

item.title: Melinda add a quote by Emily Bronte
item.description: "It was not the thorn bending to the honeysuckles, but the honeysuckles embracing the thorn." -- Emily Bronte

item.title: Melinda add a quote by Dan Brown
item.description: "Science and religion are not at odds. Science is simply too young to understand." -- Dan Brown

item.title: Melinda add a quote by Shannon Hale
item.description: "Right now I'd like all my troubles to stand in front of me in a straight line, and one by one I'd give each a black eye. " -- Shannon Hale

item.title: Melinda add a quote by Shannon Hale
item.description: "Mama used to say, you have to know someone a thousand days before you can glimpse her soul." -- Shannon Hale

item.title: Melinda add a quote by J.M. Barrie
item.description: "Nothing is really work unless you would rather be doing something else." -- J.M. Barrie

item.title: Melinda add a quote by J.M. Barrie
item.description: "If you have it [love], you don't need to have anything else, and if you don't have it, it doesn't matter much what else you have." -- J.M. Barrie

item.title: Melinda add a quote by John Steinbeck
item.description: "He is one of those whom God has not quite finished." -- John Steinbeck
